definition: lit. diligent and never slacking (idiom); continuous concentrated effort/assiduous (in study)/to concentrate
instructing with tireless zeal (idiom, from Analects)
study tirelessly, teach with endless enthusiasm (idiom, from Analects)
pinyin: xue2 er2 bu4 yan4 , hui4 ren2 bu4 juan4

sentences.english: Our Prime Minister is unwearied to work for people.
sentences.chinese: 我们的总理孜孜不倦地为人民工作。

sentences.english: They were still driving away at the encyclopaedia.
sentences.chinese: 他们仍在孜孜不倦地编写那部百科全书。

sentences.english: They are tireless in hunting for super-profits.
sentences.chinese: 他们总是不倦地追求超额利润。

sentences.english: He was enthused by biochemistry at HKUST and worked hard as he enjoyed his studies.
sentences.chinese: 科大生物化学系令他全情投入，好学不倦。

sentences.english: He perseveres in his work makes us shame.
sentences.chinese: 他孜孜不倦的干劲使我们大家惭愧。

sentences.english: Refine fine goods for people is the company' s persevering pursue.
sentences.chinese: 精制良品为万民是公司孜孜不倦的追求。

sentences.english: She persevered with her violin lessons.
sentences.chinese: 她孜孜不倦地学习小提琴。
循循善诱，诲人不倦的是老师。

sentences.english: Their toils and tireless courage were our salvat .
sentences.chinese: 他们艰苦的工作和不倦的勇气拯救了我们。

sentences.english: The scientists persevered with their experiments until they succeeded.
sentences.chinese: 科学家孜孜不倦地进行试验，直到取得成功。

sentences.english: LuoXiaoChun tirelessly to propose to gu buildings, and finally succeeded.
sentences.chinese: 骆晓春孜孜不倦地向顾阡陌求婚，终于获得了成功。

sentences.english: He was unwearied in His efforts to save this vine of His own planting.
sentences.chinese: 他不倦不息地努力要挽救自己所种植的葡萄树。

sentences.english: The retired worker repairs the entire tire tirelessly.
sentences.chinese: 退休工人不倦地修理整个轮胎。

sentences.english: As I walk'd where the ripples continually wash you Paumanok.
sentences.chinese: 我不倦地行走去洗刷跑马洛克的涟漪。

sentences.english: The unflagging optimism of a good leader energizes everyone.
sentences.chinese: 一个好领导者的不倦的乐观情绪可以激励每一个人。

sentences.english: He is a man of untiring industry.
sentences.chinese: 他是位孜孜不倦努力不懈的人。

definition: lit. diligent and never slacking (idiom); continuous concentrated effort/assiduous (in study)/to concentrate
not to tire of/not to object to
instructing with tireless zeal (idiom, from Analects)
to burn the midnight oil (idiom); to work continuously night and day
to persevere unremittingly (idiom); to keep going until the end
to make a living by writing/to write (as an author)
lit. always with a book in hand (idiom)/fig. (of a student or scholar) diligent and hardworking
to chip away at a task and not abandon it (idiom); to chisel away at sth/to persevere/unflagging efforts
